description: From Ancient Greek λεπτόν (leptón), neuter form of λεπτός (leptós, “small”).

entries.meaning: A coin used since ancient times in Greece, serving in modern times as one hundredth of a phoenix, a drachma, and a euro (as the Greek form of the Eurocent).
A small, bronze Judean coin from the 1st century BCE, considered by some to be the widow's mite.

description: From Ancient Greek λεπτός (leptós)  +‎ -on. Coined by Dutch-American physicist Abraham Pais in 1947.

entries.meaning: (particle physics) An elementary particle that has a spin of 1/2 (i.e., is a fermion) and does not interact via the strong nuclear force; examples include the electron, the muon, the neutrino and the tauon.
